factoid: Lord God hears prayers.

Lord God puts a bow of brass in the hands of those who have armed themselves in His Name.
Lord God girds the loins of those armed in His Name with strength for the fight.
Lord God takes up the spear and shield and arises to help us.
Lord God confounds those who have devised evil against us.
Lord God puts those who have devised evil against us to shame.
Lord God turns the enemies into dust before the wind.
Lord God confounds the enemies and puts them to flight.
Lord God ensnares the enemies when they do not know.
Lord God turns the enemies' plots against them.
Lord God lets the enemies fall before the servants' feet.
Lord God lays the enemies low by our hosts.
Lord God saves both great and small.
Lord God is God.
Lord God is able to save.
Lord God is God and man cannot prevail against Him.
Lord God remembers His bounteous mercy.
Lord God remembers His loving-kindness.
Lord God does not turn His face from us.
Lord God is gracious to our unworthiness.
Lord God regards not our transgressions.
Lord God regards not our iniquities.
Lord God creates in us a clean heart.
Lord God renews a right spirit within us.
Lord God strengthens us all in His faith.
Lord God fortifies our hope.
Lord God inspires us with true love for one another.
Lord God arms us with unity of spirit.
Lord God defends the heritage He gave to us and to our fathers.
Lord God does not allow the scepter of the wicked to exalt against the destiny of those He sanctified.

Lord God puts those who hate us and our Orthodox faith to shame.

Lord God lets all nations know that He is the Lord.
Lord God grants us His salvation.

Lord God smites down our enemies.
Lord God destroys our enemies swiftly beneath the feet of His faithful servants.

Lord God is the succor of those who trust in Him.
Lord God is the victory of those who trust in Him.
Lord God is the Lord.
Lord God is the Father.
Lord God is the Son.
Lord God is the Holy Ghost.
Lord God has world without end.
Natásha is a person.
Natásha listened to every word about the victory of Moses over Amalek.
Natásha listened to every word about the victory of Gideon over Midian.
Natásha listened to every word about the victory of David over Goliath.
Natásha listened to every word about the destruction of Jerusalem.
Natásha prayed to God with tenderness and emotion.
Natásha's heart was overflowing.
Natásha did not fully understand what she was asking of God.
Natásha shared her heart in the prayer for the spirit of righteousness.
Natásha prayed for the strengthening of the heart by faith and hope.
Natásha prayed for the animation of the heart by love.
Natásha could not pray that her enemies might be trampled under foot.
Natásha wished she had more enemies.
Natásha could not doubt the righteousness of the prayer.
Natásha felt devout awe at the thought of punishment that overtakes men for their sins.
Natásha felt devout awe at the thought of punishment that overtakes her own sins.
Natásha prayed to God to forgive all people.
Natásha prayed to God to forgive herself.
Natásha prayed to God to give all people peace and happiness.
Natásha prayed to God to give herself peace and happiness.
God heard Natásha's prayer.
Natásha's prayer affected her strongly.
